answers.answer: Various help-lines are available for refugees in Romania, covering general support, government information, anti-trafficking, medical support, children's support, accommodation, and city-specific assistance. Help-lines are also available for domestic violence, sexual abuse, and human trafficking.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: You can contact the Romanian National Council for Refugees (CNRR) by calling ✆ 0040 730 073 170.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The help-line of the Romanian Government for information about rights and services for refugees is accessible Monday-Friday between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists a contact number (+40 723 653 651) for UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, but does not specify the services they provide.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals can get support from the National Line against Trafficking in Persons Romania by calling ✆ +40 800 800 678 or ✆ +40 21 313 3100.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medical support for HIV treatment or services for those from Ukraine is available via Sens Pozitiv at +40 744 682 225. Support and guidance for rare diseases are offered by The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania, with contacts Dorica Dan (+40 726 248 707, +40 260 610 033) and Svetleska Yulia for Ukrainian language (+40 746 347 589).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Children can receive free counseling from Save the Children via 0800 070 040. Guidance and information on child protection are available at +40 744 300 476 (Monday-Friday, 9:00-17:00) or via email at suportucraina@salvaticopiii.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: For support with accommodation requests and information on stay conditions in Romania, you can contact the General Inspectorate for Immigration (Bucharest Directorate of Immigration) by calling 0214109940. The content does not describe a specific process beyond this contact.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: In Sibiu, you can contact the City Hall’s TelVerde at +40 800 811 822. In Timișoara, the City Hall call center is available at +40 356 993.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: In the Republic of Moldova, migration and asylum assistance is available 24/7 from the Migration and Asylum Office at 080001527, and from the Law Center of Moldova at +373 60574848.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The National Agency for Equal Opportunities for Women and Men offers a help-line for domestic violence and sexual abuse, which can be reached at +40 800 500 333.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: You can contact the Romanian Red Cross (CRR) for assistance by calling ✆ 4021 317 60 06.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The content provides the help-line number (+40 219590) for the Romanian Border Police in Ukrainian language but does not specify what information is provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Geeks for Democracy Solidarity Call Center serves as a solidarity call center, contactable at +40 377 300 300. The specific purpose beyond being a 'Solidarity Call Center' is not detailed in the provided content.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Geeks for Democracy Solidarity Call Center supports calls in Romanian, English, Ukrainian, and Russian languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the page carefully.
